website_summaries.verdict: TrueFit lives up to its name as it keeps you cool and dry during your adventures. It's extremely durable and easy to find the right size for your kayak.
cons: Fairly pricey, but it’s a high-end skirt

customer_reviews.title: Works fits great but very tight on large paddler
customer_reviews.text: Used them today on pungo 120 and 125. Fit well and tight to get on but held the seal in a windy cool day. Definitely kept us warm and out of the breeze and kept splash out of cockpit. I'm large guy and the body portion is very tight. Not more than 2" of adjust in the Velcro tabs. Son is smaller And it fit him well but not snugly as it was on me. Any bigger and I would not be able to zip closed. Two way zipper is nice for air flow. Front rib adjusted well to avoid pooling.
customer_reviews.author: Sabot

customer_reviews.title: very well made, excellent idea on the two way zipper
customer_reviews.text: This product is well made. It fits my Widlerness pongo 120 that is at least 6 years old. I love how the zippers work: you can attach this to your kayak (instead of wearing this item and then getting in), and then unzip the opening and climb in. And the zipper opens from the other end too! fantastic. Another super nice feature is the support that keeps water from welling up in your lap. This is just snug enough to stay put but be pulled off in a jiffy if that is called for. This BTW, was for the largest skirt.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy T.

customer_reviews.title: Well designed
customer_reviews.text: This is the right skirt if you are looking for a tight fit that won’t roll off when you do. Using on WS Tsunami cockpit. Needed to stretch it out for a couple days so I could put it on in the water. Comes with adjustment cord if it ever loosens too much. Bow at right place for knees.
customer_reviews.author: JimBob443

customer_reviews.title: Like the tight fit, but issues with implosion bar
customer_reviews.text: Willing to adjust the rating if I can get with customer service but I finally was able to use this this past weekend. After the first use there was a tear created by the implosion bar. Everything else about it was great even if a bit difficult to get on...but I prefer that over a loose spray skirt. If this had been much cheaper I would ignore the tear because it doesn't impact the waterproofness (that I noticed), but at this price I don't expect it to get torn by it's own features. Since it was created by the sharp corners of the implosion bar I expect the hole will only get worse and bigger as I use it more.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit Tsunami 125
customer_reviews.text: Although the sizing chart explicitly says that this fits the Tsunami 125... It simply does not. I'm a big dude, and after pulling as hard as I could, every possible way, for quite a while, there is just no way to get it around the cockpit.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Earp

customer_reviews.title: Will keep you warm and dry.
customer_reviews.text: I love Wildernesses Systems products. True to their reputation the spray skirt fits the kayak and me perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Drp

customer_reviews.title: W7 right for Tempest 170
customer_reviews.text: W7 size on a Tempest 170 was right on. The Tempest cockpit is 2 inches shorter and narrower than the Tsunami so would not advise the W7 for Tsunami. With just swimming shorts I stayed warm in 64 degree air temp and 60 degree water temp. Zipper average smoothness so I lubricated with bicycle "ice wax".
customer_reviews.author: Gerard J.

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed for rough water and colder weather.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Bungee cird is strong. Kept water out. Also adds warmth for legs in cooler weather and does not get overly hot or uncomfortable in 90 degrees weather with 60 percent humidty.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Size Matters
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the size specified does not match the actual sized sent. If you have a kayak other than a wilderness systems kayak, be extra careful. It mentions fitting a kayak 34-36" X width 18-20", my Point65 SeaCruiser met all the specifications but not just didn't fit. The replacement sent was the same W7 size and was actually slightly bigger then the first one. FYI @WildernessSystems. Must be a QC thing.
customer_reviews.author: Jude Nonis

customer_reviews.title: Great spray skirt for Pelican Mustang 100x and 120x
customer_reviews.text: Great fit. I have a Pelican Mustang 100x and 120x, this thing fits perfectly. I plan to buy a second one of these so I have one for each kayak.
customer_reviews.author: wesg

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit Wilderness Systems Tsunami 145
customer_reviews.text: As other reviews state, this does not fit a wilderness systems tsunami 145 as it should. Struggled to get this on as a test fit at home, and was completely unsuccessful out on the water today. I’ll be looking or other options ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy S

customer_reviews.title: Fits my WS Pungo 120
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, snug, rugged, perfect fit. I love the zipper. I love the pouch. Comes with suspenders.
customer_reviews.author: ithompson

customer_reviews.title: W7 spray skirt - Tsunami 125
customer_reviews.text: Product: Wilderness W7 true fit spray skirt. Kayak: Wilderness Tsunami 125 Review: works as intended, it’s a tight fit but it fits and stays on snug.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This skirt laughs at your pathetic skirt.
customer_reviews.text: Zipper pocket for storage on top is clutch Also love that it allowed access into the kayak without taking it off.
customer_reviews.author: BRYAN W.

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention
customer_reviews.text: The suspenders fell off the first time I used it I dont know where they are lost forever.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not too tight around the waist.
customer_reviews.text: I had read a couple of reviews about this skirt being too tight around the waist for "big guys", but I guess those reviewers must have been REALLY big guys. I'm 6' 4" / 240lbs, but I don't have any issues with it being too tight around my waist.. As for the fit, it perfectly fits the 52" X 22" cockpit on my WindRider-16 trimaran.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: A great skirt and the recommended size does fit perfectly (W7, tsunami 140). It is very difficult to get on the first time but it helps if it is warmed in the sun first and left in place on the kayak for a while. It then becomes easy to use. The adjustable bow sheds water away very well and the storage pocket is very handy. The two way zip makes it very easy to access things inside the kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Eilsel

customer_reviews.title: The fit is great.
customer_reviews.text: I have an older pongo. I measured the opening before I purchased. It fit like a charm. Worked great when I went over a small waterfall this weekend. Wish it came in more colors. Not nuts about the color. This past weekend it was cold and it kept me nice and warm. I like that it unzips far down so I can get in and out of the kayak without taking off the spray skirt.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine C.

customer_reviews.title: W7 great fit on Stellar 16
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit with the W7 on my Stellar 16. I love the access zipper into the cockpit and the pocket to keep small items handy. The zipper also provides a little cooling without taking the skirt off in warmer weather and is easy to put on.
customer_reviews.author: ECSEteacher

customer_reviews.title: Fits Pungo 120 kayaks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of them for my Pungo 120 Ultralight kayak and a newer Pungo 120 kayak. This spray skirt fits both. Well made with some good features such as a zipper to open the skirt at the lap area and a mesh pocket.
customer_reviews.author: woodyduck

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for our Wilderness Systems Tsunami 140 & 145 kayaks
customer_reviews.text: Product is excellent - perfect fit for our kayaks & just what we were looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Klwp

customer_reviews.title: W7 Size Does Not Fit Wilderness Tsunami 125 Kayak
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item from Amazon because the product description stated that it fit a Wilderness Systems Tsunami 125 kayak. The spray skirt I received was too small to fit over the coaming on my Wilderness Tsunami 125 kayak. After struggling with it for 40 minutes on 2 separate trips to lakes, I decided to return it. Buyer beware: "Made in China".
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Complete Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: This is a complete waste of money. It does not fit the pungo 125 as it states that its supposed to, and its pockets are not even water tight.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Meltzer

product_meta.title: Wilderness Systems TrueFit Spray Skirt
product_meta.description:
The Wilderness Systems TrueFit System provides the best fit possible for Wilderness Systems kayaks so that you stay dry. Determining the best fit for your kayak has never been easier. Size information on all Wilderness Systems kayaks identifies the TrueFit size for your kayak. No charts or measuring are required. Sticky edging grips the cockpit rim tightly and adds extra durability. Implosion bar prevents water from pooling on top of the skirt. A water-resistant tunnel zipper allows hot air to vent out when unzipped and keeps you dry when zipped closed. All seams are double stitched and seam taped for premium durability and waterproof performance. Large zippered mesh pocket on deck for storing items that can get wet. Grab handle includes a clip that can attach to your PFD while walking. Adjustable neoprene chest band with removable suspenders. Bungee rand for easy on/off. Ultra durable urethane coated nylon

Specifications:
Skirt Type: Recreational, Material: Urethane coated nylon
feature_bullets: High quality spray skirt keeps you dry and warm while paddling
Compatible with these Wilderness Systems kayaks: Tempest 165/170 and tsunami 125/140/145/165/175
Also fits other kayaks with cockpit dimensions: length 34-36" X width 18-20"
Sticky edging grips the cockpit rim tightly and adds extra durability
A water-resistant tunnel zipper allows hot air to vent out when unzipped and keeps you dry when zipped closed.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
